titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the William J. Ronan papers FA1299
titlestmt.author: Katie Martin

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-09-12 16:18:16 -0400.

physdesc.extent: 22 boxes - 9 legal document containers, 9 letter document containers, 1 half-letter document container, 1 half-legal document container, 1 oversize document container, and 1 clamshell document container

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: William J. Ronan was born on Nov. 8, 1912. He graduated from Syracuse University in 1934 and began teaching government at New York University in 1938. Ronan earned a PhD in international law and diplomacy from NYU in 1940, where he was hired as an assistant professor of government. From 1953-1958, he served as the Dean of NYU's Robert F. Wagner Graduate School of Public Service. Ronan was appointed Secretary to the Governor in Nelson Rockefeller's administration and served in this capacity from 1959-1966. He left this position to work for the newly-created Metropolitan Commuter Transportation Authority which became the Metropolitan Transportation Authority in 1968. Ronan served as the first chairman of the MTA until 1974. Under his leadership, the MTA began major improvement projects. He left the MTA to serve as chairman of the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey until 1977. From 1980-1986, Ronan served as the Director of the National Health Council. He remained an advisor to the Rockefeller family until 1990 and retired from public service to work as an adviser to transportation companies, government agencies, and nonprofits as well as serve on corporate boards. Ronan died in 2014 at the age of 101.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: This material was transferred to the RAC in 2016 by Diana Ronan Quasha and ingested by RAC as Accession 2016:040

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC. Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

When requesting to view audiovisual material, please refer to the Title and the AV Number (example: AV 1916). Researchers are asked to check the "Restrictions" note for each Title. If a Title does not currently have an access copy, please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The William J. Ronan papers consist of materials related to Ronan's years of service as Secretary to the Governor of the State of New York during Nelson Rockefeller's administration, Chairman of the Metropolitan Transportation Authority, and Chairman of the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey. The collection contains diaries and planners documenting his daily activities as well as clippings, reports, photographs, awards, and a personal memoir.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The William J. Ronan papers are arranged into one series: Personal Papers

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Nelson A. Rockefeller gubernatorial records, William J. Ronan, Series 29 (FA371)
